articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Guatemala
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Guatemala
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Otto Perez Molina, president of the Republic of Guatemala, on September 21 on the occasion of the 191st anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message expressed conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the common interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Chilean President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Chilean President
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting on Sept. 15 to Sebastian Pinera Echenique, president of the Republic of Chile, on its 202nd independence day.
					 Kim in the message wished the friendly people of Chile well-being and prosperity, expressing hope that the president would achieve greater success in his work for the country's development and social justice.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Nicaraguan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Nicaraguan President
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent greetings to Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega Saavedra on Friday on the 191st anniversary of independence of Nicaragua.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.
					
					 He wished the president greater success in his noble work for the country's sustained economic development and people's well-being.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Greets Chilean FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Greets Chilean FM
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun on Sept. 15 sent a message of greeting to Chilean Foreign Minister Alfredo Moreno Charme on the occasion of the 202nd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: S. Korean Navy's Intrusion into Territorial Waters of DPRK Censured
articles.content:
S. Korean Navy's Intrusion into Territorial Waters of DPRK Censured
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The Southwest Front Command of the Korean People's Army issued the following pres release on Saturday:
					 The south Korean puppet forces' grave intrusion into the waters of the West Sea is again going beyond the tolerance limit in the season for catching blue crab.
					
					 The number of the cases of intrusion of warships of the south Korean navy into the territorial waters of the DPRK is on the steady increase and the sphere of their intrusion is gaining in depth as the days go by.  Provocative and reckless firing and shelling targeted against the DPRK are being committed from the five islands and waters around them almost every day.
					
					 Many speedboats of the south Korean navy intruded deep into the territorial waters of the DPRK side along the maritime demarcation line southwest of Yonphyong Island several times on Sept. 21 alone, kicking up a firing and shelling racket.
					
					 The gravity of the situation is that though they claimed those boats they encountered were obviously peaceful civilian ones, the south Korean forces fired bullets and shells at them at random.
					
					 Such hysteria is nothing but an adventurous military provocation which can be orchestrated only by the south Korean military warmongers accustomed to mimicking the bad habit of the U.S., their master fond of saber-rattling.
					
					 What matters is that such military provocations are being committed under the pretext of the disorderly fishing operations of fishing boats of other country, not ones of the DPRK.
					
					 Worse still, such provocations are being perpetrated by them on the basis of lies and far-fetched assertions that fishing boats of the DPRK crossed the illegal "northern limit line" which has never been recognized.
					
					 The puppet forces have gone so despicable as to insist that they were ships of the DPRK for fear of the country to which they actually belonged.
					
					 They intruded into the DPRK's territorial waters and fired shells and bullets. But they raised a hue and cry, afraid of the possible countermeasure of the army of the DPRK. This shows the pitiful position of the puppet military which goes reckless while making far-fetched assertions to maintain the "northern limit line" at any cost.
					
					  The Lee Myung Bak puppet regime and the military warmongers would be well advised to realize their wretched situation and stop running riot.
					
					 The Southwestern Front Command has already received the operation order from the Supreme Command to turn the West Sea of Korea into a deadfall of enemies and wage a great war for national reunification if enemies fire even a bullet into the area of the DPRK side.
					
					 What remains to be done now is a powerful strike of the DPRK's front units which know of no limit.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Hit for Moving to Stage PSI with Outsiders
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Hit for Moving to Stage PSI with Outsiders
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the National Peace Committee of Korea issued the following statement Saturday:
					 The south Korean puppet regime is to hold a naval interception drill, part of PSI, for searching and tracking vessels suspected of carrying weapons of mass destruction with the involvement of huge troops together with the U.S., Japan and Australia in waters off Pusan on Sept. 26 and 27.
					
					 PSI which the Bush administration cooked up to blockade and stifle anti-U.S. and independent countries like the DPRK in 2003 has drawn strong public denunciation from its outset as it was in wanton violation of international law and a product of brigandish aggression moves in serious breach of the Korean Armistice Agreement.
					
					 The U.S. openly said that PSI is "another arrow in the quiver targeting north Korea", an indication of the provocative and aggressive nature of the drill.
					
					 So, the preceding regime of south Korea was reluctant to take part in the drill.
					
					 But the Lee Myung Bak regime, steeped in sycophancy toward the U.S. and confrontation with the fellow countrymen, decided to take part in PSI as its full member soon after it took office. It even took an active part in it, saying that "PSI is not needed but for the north".
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet army's reckless anti-DPRK war moves deepened the tensions on the Korean Peninsula. The puppet regime now moves to stage PSI drill against this backdrop, a dangerous act of disclosing its attempt at aggression on the DPRK and increasing the danger of a war.
					
					 The Committee strongly denounces in the name of all the Koreans the U.S. and Lee regime's criminal moves as an intolerable military provocation and a war act aimed to seriously encroach upon the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK and ignite a war of aggression at any cost.
					
					 The south Koreans from all walks of life are strongly opposed to the drill that escalates military tensions on the Korean Peninsula and harasses the peace in Northeast Asia, and countries around it are expressing deep concerns about it.
					
					 The DPRK already clarified that it will view south Korea's participation in PSI as a declaration of a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never remain an on-looker to the mad-cap war drill.
					
					 They have already occupied combat positions and are waiting for an order for a final charge in the face of the reckless war provocation racket on the part of the U.S. and the south Korean regime. If the enemies fire even a bullet on the DPRK, they will strongly retaliate against them with merciless just war as it had already declared and turn the group of aggressors into forlorn wandering spirits.
					
					 The Lee regime should clearly understand the towering grudge and spirit of annihilating enemies of the army and people of the DPRK and do not act rashly.
					
					 South Koreans of all social standings and world peace-loving people should strongly stand against PSI drill that escalates military tension on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia and brings the danger of a nuclear war.

articles.title: DPRK Financial Delegation Returns Home
articles.content:
DPRK Financial Delegation Returns Home
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- A financial delegation of the DPRK led by Ki Kwang Ho, vice-minister of Finance, returned home Saturday after visiting Russia.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations Arrive
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations Arrive
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Delegations from China, Germany and Taipei of China arrived here Saturday to take part in the 8th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair.
					 Arriving here earlier were a delegate of French and a delegation of Italy.

articles.title: Greetings from Malian President
articles.content:
Greetings from Malian President
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) --  Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Dioncounda Traore, president and head of state of Mali, on September 9.
					 The Malian president in his message said that it gives him particular pleasure to extend the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the Korean people on behalf of the Malian people and on his own behalf on the occasion of its national holiday.
					
					 He sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK greater progress and prosperity. 
					
					 He sent the highest regards to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid Saturday before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of her death.
					 Placed before the bust was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at a wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae and other leading officials of the party, state and army, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, the Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service persons of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and Pyongyangites.
					
					 Laid before the bust were wreaths in the name of the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the SPA and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 Also laid before the bust were those in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, KPA units, educational, literary and arts, public health and media institutions, the Joint National Organization of the Korean Children's Union, party and power organs, factories and farms in the city.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Suk, looking back on her immortal life. 
					
					 Floral baskets were placed before the statues of Kim Jong Suk in Kim Jong Suk County, Hoeryong City, at Kim Jong Suk Naval University and Kim Jong Suk General Military Academy on the same day.

articles.title: Cuba's Will to Stand alongside DPRK on Anti-US Joint Front Reiterated
articles.content:
Cuba's Will to Stand alongside DPRK on Anti-US Joint Front Reiterated
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Joaquin Quintas Sola, vice-minister of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, gave his deep impressions of the DPRK. 
					 He said:
					
					 Visiting the DPRK from Sept 5 to 10, I came to know well about what is the source of such tremendous strength of the army and the people of the DPRK.
					
					 This strength stems from the undisputed trust of all service personnel and people of the DPRK in their leader and their firm faith in victory.
					
					 Their indomitable fighting spirit inspires the Cuban army and people. 
					
					 We rejoice as over our own over the astonishing successes made by the DPRK.
					
					 I was deeply impressed to visit the Museum of Arms and Equipment of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Such splendid museum is rare to be found in the world.
					
					 There are exhibitions of weaponry in different countries.
					
					 However, they are not comparable to this museum in exhibits on display and structure. 
					
					I was struck with admiration at the greatness of Marshal Kim Jong Un who carries forward the Songun cause of the preceding leaders with loyalty.
					
					 I once again keenly realized the might of the Songun politics.
					
					 I was deeply moved to hear that Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un inspected Panmunjom and island defence detachments and encouraged the sentinels there.
					
					 I realized his unshakable will to implement the last instructions of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for the country's reunification.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, one of the great men, brightly indicates the road for progressive mankind to follow.
					
					 The prevailing complicated situation calls upon the two countries to successfully uphold the banner of socialism shoulder to shoulder.
					
					 Though Cuba and the DPRK are far away from each other geographically, the armies and peoples of the two countries are struggling as close comrades-in-arms in the joint struggle to accomplish the cause of socialism.
					
					  Cuba and the DPRK are standing up together against the U.S. moves for aggression.
					
					 We will firmly join hands with each other and boost the exchange and cooperation with the KPA.
					
					  I am convinced that the delegation's visit to the DPRK contributed to consolidating and developing the friendly relations between the armies of the two countries for justice, peace and socialism.
					
					 The Cuban revolutionary armed forces will always stand alongside the heroic KPA on the anti-imperialist and anti-U.S. joint front.

articles.title: Crew of Chinese Ship Rescue Korean Fishermen
articles.content:
Crew of Chinese Ship Rescue Korean Fishermen 
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- A few days ago, crew members of a Chinese ship belonging to a fishery group of Shandong Province of China rescued Korean fishermen aboard a drifting ship.
					 They were engaged in fishing in waters off Tanchon of South Hamgyong Province. But an unexpected engine trouble and strong wind and sea storm forced their boat to go adrift.
					
					 Three fishermen were aboard the boat.
					
					 It was at about 18:00 on Sept. 16 that the boat was spotted.
					
					 It was discovered by the Chinese ship which was sailing towards waters off Rason to take shelter after receiving an alarm signal during its joint fishing operation in waters off Hungnam.
					
					 Veering its ship, the Chinese crew rescued all the Korean fishermen.
					
					 The Chinese crew made sincere efforts to provide every convenience to the Korean fishermen.
					
					 The Chinese ship arrived in waters off Rason at about 10 a.m. on Sept. 17. and officials concerned warmly welcomed the fisherman.
					
					 The deed displayed by the crew of the Chinese ship is an expression of the noble sense of moral obligation cherished by the peoples of the DPRK and China.

articles.title: National Korean Dress Exhibition Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
National Korean Dress Exhibition Held in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The 10th National Korean Dress Exhibition took place at the Central Youth Hall on the bank of Taedong River here on Sept. 19-21.
					 The exhibition brought together more than 1 300 items of casual, gala, wedding and children's clothes, presented by Pyongyang and other local areas.
					
					 Pak Hyon Sik, secretary of the Korean Apparel Association, told KCNA:
					
					 "The exhibition was held under the theme 'Korean-style Garments, Reflection of Intentions of the Peerlessly Great Persons.'
					
					 All the exhibits were designed to represent national characters.
					
					 The exhibition showcased rapid progress in garment designing and processing. It was highly appreciated for display of a number of seasonal clothes."
					
					 Jong Hwa Suk, a designer at the Central District Tailor Shop in Pyongyang, said:
					
					 "I have finished first at the annual exhibition for consecutive five years.
					
					 In designing clothes I tried to mirror the socialist cultural features as well as nobleness and uprightness of the Korean women."
					
					 Kim Ok Bun, a visitor to the exhibition, said:
					
					 "The exhibits have no eye-catching decorations and ornaments, but they all look plain, elegant and innovative, reflecting the aesthetic sense and emotions of the Korean women."
					
					 The exhibition witnessed a presentation of garment technology, fashion show and clothing books and multi-media show.

articles.title: Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival under Way
articles.content:
Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival under Way
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival is now under way here, starting on Thursday.
					 Many of the participants are newcomers to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 KCNA met Christian Studer Dianel, president and producer of the Swiss Minerva Film Company, at the mock-up location street here.
					
					 He said:
					
					 "It is the first time for me to visit the DPRK. I actually support young movie makers in Switzerland.
					
					 I received the news of the Pyongyang international film festival on the Internet and decided to present movie to this festival.
					
					 I felt welcome and great hospitality when I arrived in Pyongyang. I am grateful for the hospitality. This film festival is well organized and its program is very interesting.
					
					 I am very, seriously, impressed because I am a movie producer.
					
					 I would be very happy to have such mock-up location street supported from the government. We don't have it. This is a brilliant street for a producer."
					
					 He came to Pyongyang with a documentary "Tones of Passion".

articles.title: Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Draws Many Viewers
articles.content:
Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Draws Many Viewers
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival is now going on before full houses. 
					 Screened at theaters and cinemas here are more than 90 pieces of feature, documentary, short and children's films presented by 50 odd organizations in 30 odd countries. 
					
					 Among the films enjoying popularity are a Chinese feature film "Blood" dealing with a storekeeper who works hard to help others in difficult living condition and a Russian feature film "House of the Wind", which shows a health worker taking paternal care of a child put at the door of death by an epidemic.
					
					 And they include German feature films "Goethe", "Big Hope" and "Close to Me", which were highly appreciated at other international film festivals, Italian feature film "The Rhabdomancer" and Pakistani feature film "Khuda Kay Live."
					
					 There are also films on the anti-aggression struggle and the people's optimistic life such as Indian feature film "Urumi, A Flexible Kalari Sword", Chinese feature film "Full Circle" and Iranian feature film "Love at Forty" and Cuban documentary "The Merit Is to Be Alive". 
					
					 Meanwhile, Korean feature films, shown at the preview, and a DPRK-Britain co-produced film "Comrade Kim Goes Flying", presented as a competitive film, give deep impressions on the moviemakers and film actors and actresses from different countries.

articles.title: Railway Service from Tanchon to Paekgumsan Restarts
articles.content:
Railway Service from Tanchon to Paekgumsan Restarts
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- More successes are reported every day from the sites for recovering from flood damage in Komdok area of the DPRK.
					 The first train ran along the reconstructed Tanchon-Paekgumsan railway at 4 p.m. on Sept. 20.
					
					 The unusual heavy rain hit mines of Komdok area at the end of last August, causing huge damage not only to the mines there but to the railways. 
					
					 The workers of the Ministry of Railways and its affiliated bureaus rushed to the flood-hit mines of Komdok area. They did such huge work as filling tens of thousands of cubic meters of soil and stones and fixing rails and sleepers, etc. by displaying popular heroism.
					
					 As a result, dozens of seriously destroyed bridges and roadbeds have been restored. 
					
					 They reconstructed the railway bridge between Ripha Station and Sinjung Station, the most difficult and vast rehabilitation project, in a matter of ten odd days by applying a reasonable method of construction and advanced working methods though it would have taken more than a month at an ordinary pace.
					
					 The rehabilitation of the railway from Tanchon City to Ryongyang Mine made a breakthrough in speeding up the overall recovery operations.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk, Mother of Songun Korea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk, Mother of Songun Korea
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, was mother of Songun Korea as she gave birth and brought up leader Kim Jong Il to be the heir to the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by President Kim Il Sung.
					 One spring day in Juche 32 (1943), Kim Il Sung told Kim Jong Suk that he was faced with an enormous task to liberate the country from the Japanese colonial rule and build socialist society in Korea. This honorable task should be carried out through generations, he stressed, asking her to bring up their son, Kim Jong Il, in a good way.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk regarded this request as her lofty mission and duty as his revolutionary soldier.
					
					 When she was asked by Kim Jong Il in his childhood about his birthplace, she answered it was Mt. Paektu where Kim Il Sung fought against the Japanese invaders.
					
					 She would tell him about battles fought in Mt. Paektu and teach revolutionary songs which were popular among the guerrillas in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle. And she personally taught him archery, horse-riding and shooting.
					
					 She also implanted in his mind an idea that a man should feel happiness in devoting himself or herself to others and trained him to be a son of the people regarding simplicity and frugality as his virtue.
					
					 Thanks to Kim Jong Suk's feats, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is now demonstrating its invincible might as the homeland of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Patriotic Devotion Remembered by Korean People
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Patriotic Devotion Remembered by Korean People
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- On the occasion of the death anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, the people in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea recall her patriotic devotion.
					 It was in December, Juche 34 (1945) that Kim Jong Suk was on the way to the Komusan Cement Factory.
					
					 A suite member suggested to her that she go to Hoeryong before visiting the factory. In Hoeryong there is her native home, which she pictured so eagerly during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 But, she refused his suggestion, saying that President Kim Il Sung was working day and night to build new Korea and she should return to Pyongyang as soon as possible, after finishing the work at the factory, to protect the safety of the President.
					
					 Kim Jong Bu, chief engineer of the factory, told KCNA: 
					
					 "The fact touches the heartstrings of the workers of the factory still now.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk, who devoted her all to the country and the people, never visited her native home in her lifetime.
					
					 Following her patriotic devotion, we will do our best for building a thriving nation, true to the guidance of the dear respected Kim Jong Un."

articles.title: Written Warranty Tells about Kim Jong Suk's Humanity
articles.content:
Written Warranty Tells about Kim Jong Suk's Humanity
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- In her lifetime Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, dedicated her all to her comrades and compatriots with noble humanity. That was why she enjoyed respects and heartfelt love from people wherever she went.
					 In this regard President Kim Il Sung in his reminiscences "With the Century" mentioned a story of written warranty telling about her humanity, which is as follows:
					
					 In the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle, Kim Il Sung assigned to Kim Jong Suk a task to do an underground work to win over the people in Taoquanli, Changbai County in northeast China.
					
					 During her underground work in this area, she took warm care of its inhabitants, regarding them as her own flesh and blood.
					
					 One day, a landlord in the village banished his young kitchen maid suffering from typhoid fever, into a hut in a mountain. Nobody dared to take care of that pitiable girl.
					
					 On hearing the news, Kim Jong Suk went to the hut without hesitation and nursed the girl, sharing bed and meals with her.
					
					 When her comrades tried to dissuade her, she said, "If we can't save a child for fear of our lives, how can we restore the country and rescue our fellow countrymen? I am determined to sacrifice my life for the sake of the people, so I fear nothing." At last she rescued the young girl from illness.
					
					 Afterwards, the people in Taoquanli began to call Kim Jong Suk "our dear Ok Sun." Ok Sun was her anonym at that time.
					
					 Since then, when they happened to get salted mackerel, they called for "our Ok Sun"; when a ceremony for a one-hundred-day-old baby was held, they asked for "our Ok Sun."
					
					 She was their daughter, granddaughter and sister, indispensable in their live.
					
					 Therefore, when she was arrested, 500 villagers prepared a warranty for a good citizen. At that time, it was a common, popular mentality not to seal rashly with one's thumb a document testifying that a "disturbing element", spotted as a "traitor" or "communist bandit", was in fact a "good citizen."
					
					 However, the villagers placed without hesitation their stamps on the document for her safety.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Noble Feats of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Noble Feats of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The life of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero, was a brilliant one of a legendary great woman who left clear footsteps in the 100 year long-history of Kim Il Sung's Korea and the one of a great revolutionary who performed noble feats to be conveyed to posterity, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a bylined article.
					 Brief as Kim Jong Suk's life was, she is always remembered by the Korean people as she set a shining example of how to live and struggle as a revolutionary and human being for the country and its people, the era and history, the article notes. 
					
					 Referring to her feats, the article goes on:
					
					 After embarking upon the road of revolution in her teens, she protected President Kim Il Sung politically and ideologically at the risk of her life and devoted her all to accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by the President.
					
					 Kim Il Sung precisely meant the destiny of the country and to protect him was the way of defending the Korean revolution. This was her maxim.
					
					 The history of the Korean revolution shining with Songun is shedding its rays as an immortal history in which she consolidated the foundation of Songun together with the President, its pioneer. 
					
					 The might of the Korean People's Army, the powerful revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu, meant the realization of the lifelong desire of Kim Jong Suk, woman commander of the guerrilla army.
					
					 She provided a basic guarantee for a bright prospect of the Korean revolution.
					
					 She gave birth to and brought up leader Kim Jong Il as a shining star of Mt. Paektu, thereby providing a sure guarantee for successfully carrying forward and accomplishing the revolutionary cause started in Mt. Paektu.
					
					 She was, indeed, the greatest revolutionary and peerless great woman who performed feats which will always shine in the human cause of independence and carved out a bright future of the Korean revolution.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls on Developing Countries to High Banner of Self-reliance
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls on Developing Countries to High Banner of Self-reliance
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The developing countries are called upon to strengthen the cooperation among themselves holding aloft the banner of collective self-reliance and make the new century a century for their prosperity.
					  Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a bylined article.
					
					  Self-reliance is the principle of struggle to be held fast to by the developing countries to achieve social progress.
					
					  They should strictly adhere to the principle of collective self-reliance. This is one of the important issues they should settle to swim with the trend of the new century and achieve a high rate of development as required by it. 
					
					 What is important for doing so is for them to tap all their possibilities and use all conditions to the maximum.
					
					  Adherence to the principle of collective self-reliance does not mean ignoring others' things.
					
					 The developing countries should firmly preserve the Juche character and national identity in applying advanced science and technology and others' good experiences.
					
					 They should try as hard as possible to develop science and technology by their own efforts.
					
					 The DPRK built dependable scientific institutions during the "Arduous March", forced march, and achieved such spectacular scientific and technological achievements as successfully launching satellites. All this was possible because the Workers' Party of Korea enforced the policy of giving importance to science and technology and actively pushed ahead with the work to implement it with much effort.
					
					 The practical experience and reality of the DPRK go to prove that any country can achieve scientific and technological progress when it maintains an independent and creative stand and buckles down to the work with a will on the principle of self-reliance.

articles.title: Sordid Story about S. Korean Construction of Naval Base Revealed
articles.content:
Sordid Story about S. Korean Construction of Naval Base Revealed
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- A sordid story about the Lee Myung Bak regime's construction of the naval base on Jeju Island was revealed in south Korea.
					 The main purpose of the puppet military is to build the naval base for ensuring the entry and departure of U.S. nuclear carriers. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This clearly indicates that the Lee group of traitors is set to offer the island to the U.S. as a bridgehead for carrying out its strategy for hegemony and a nuclear outpost.
					
					 The regime's reckless construction of the base is a grave action against the nation and peace as it is aimed not only at further escalating the military confrontation and tension between the north and the south of Korea, backed by foreign forces keen to realize the ambition to put the whole world under its control, but at pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia to an extreme pitch of tension.
					
					 While pushing forward the construction of the base, the regime seeks to organize a Jeju unit under the Marine Corps and deploy a task fleet, a flotilla of submarines, a flotilla for supporting the ground forces, air search unit and fighter squadron in its area in a bid to turn the island into a fortress.
					
					 As seen above, it is a very dangerous move of the group to build such large naval base so that a super-large nuclear carrier flotilla may enter the island.
					
					This is the very reason why the Lee regime is building the base with an investment of huge funds defying strong public protest and condemnation.
					
					 By making the construction project irreversible during the tenure of its office the regime seeks to garner support from the U.S. and the pro-U.S. conservative forces in an effort to stay in power.
					
					 The desperate efforts of traitor Lee Myung Bak and the group of "the Saenuri Party" to seek a way out in going ahead with the above-said construction project would only bring to bolder relief their ugly true colors as nuclear war servants for foreign forces.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Derides S. Korea's "Unification Jar" as Political Cartoon
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Derides S. Korea's "Unification Jar" as Political Cartoon
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime keeps staging the farce of "unification jar" allegedly to raise fund for unification.
					 Shortly ago, the puppet Unification Ministry announced that it would hold the event of "unification jar land-crossing journey" in which the participants would pass through 12 major cities of south Korea by bike.
					
					 The regime plunged the favorably-developing north-south ties into a deadlock by escalating confrontation with the fellow countrymen and created the touch-and-go situation. It is a sort of political cartoon for it to clamor for "unification jar" and "cost for unification".
					
					 This burlesque staged by the Lee Myung Bak regime of traitors is aimed to cover up its traitorous and anti-reunification nature and incite confrontation with the fellow countrymen.
					
					 The regime put "unification jar" on display and has underlined the need for getting "prepared for unification" whenever an opportunity presented itself. It even opened a movement website as part of it.
					
					 By abusing the "jar" that conjures up nostalgia among the people, the regime is desperately trying to win the public mindset for unification in south Korea.
					
					 Is it "fund" that is needed for unification?
					
					 The Korean nation has keenly felt the truth and vitality of the nation's concord through their life experience after the publication of the June 15 north-south joint declaration.
					
					 Roads and railways between the north and the south had been re-linked even though they were cut off for more than half a century and air and sea routes were opened for the people in the north and the south to visit each other and carry out cooperation projects. They were excited, hoping that reunification will come soon. As the projects progressed, the north and the south adopted and published the October 4 declaration, an action programme for implementing the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 But at a time when all the Koreans were advancing toward reunification, the Lee Myung Bak regime that staked its fate on escalated confrontation emerged. It brought the north-south ties to a collapse and created the touch-and-go situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The south Koreans from all walks of life are unanimously denouncing the conservative regime's moves for escalating confrontation between social systems against reunification and are determined to force it to pay a dear price for having blocked the nation in its way for independent reunification, peace and prosperity.
					
					 The regime, which is indifferent to the nation's reconciliation, unity and independent reunification, has escalated confrontation with the fellow countrymen while staging "unification jar" farce. It has tried hard to cover up its political failure and prolong its dirty remaining days.
					
					 No wonder, even south Korean politicians charged Lee with "staking his fate on the policy of 'unification jar' even though the hope for improving the south-north ties has disappeared."
					
					 No matter how desperately the Lee regime may try to cover up its hideous traitorous crimes with the jar farce, it can never be able to escape from its destined miserable fate. So will its jar for confrontation.

articles.title: Protest Action Staged in Demand of Release of Prisoners of Conscience
articles.content:
Protest Action Staged in Demand of Release of Prisoners of Conscience
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The Joint Action for Meeting with Prisoners of Conscience in south Korea launched a protest action on September 17 to lay bare the human rights situation and demand the release of the prisoners of conscience, while touring all parts of south Korea.
					 That day the organization held a press conference outside the detention house in Seoul.
					
					 A press release was read out there.
					
					 It deplored that the prisoners of conscience and their families are forced to live in agony, separated from them due to the political suppression in the land torn with human rights abuses.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime is doing all kinds of favor for the criminals involved in scandals by abuse of power while intensifying the crackdown upon the unreasonably detained prisoners of conscience in the closing period of its rule, it noted, and went on:
					
					 It is the way for the regime to apologize to history for having violated democracy to set free the prisoners of conscience.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime should not resort to the suppression any longer but release all the prisoners of conscience behind bars, it urged.

articles.title: Action Staged in S. Korea in Demand of Probe into Truth behind Murder Case
articles.content:
Action Staged in S. Korea in Demand of Probe into Truth behind Murder Case
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The Preparatory Committee of the All-people Measure Committee for Probing the Suspected Assassination of Jang Jun Ha of south Korea held a meeting of proclaiming a one-million signature campaign to probe the truth behind the murder of Jang Jun Ha committed by the "yusin" dictatorial regime in Kwanghwamun of Seoul on Sept. 19.
					 An appeal was made public at the meeting.
					
					 The appeal said:
					
					 The shocking fact was disclosed in the course of moving the grave of Jang who passed away several decades ago that he did not fall to death but was killed. 
					
					 Jang was the activist who devoted himself to democratization and the movement for reunification in protest against the "yusin" dictatorship, the appeal noted, calling upon the people from all walks of life to participate in the signature campaign to probe the truth behind the murder.
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 Speakers urged the "National Assembly" to probe the truth behind the murder in a responsible manner and open to public the then murderers.
					
					 The "Saenuri Party," in particular, should reinstate those killed in the period of the "yusin" dictatorship and let the people know about  history properly, they urged.

articles.title: Stronger Movement for Peaceful Reunification Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stronger Movement for Peaceful Reunification Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Activists for reunification in south Korea inaugurated the Way of Reunification, an organization for the movement for peaceful reunification, in Seoul on September 19.
					 In a declaration the organization said the true driving force for the movement for independent and peaceful reunification is all the people including workers, peasants, youth, students and intellectuals of conscience.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime is creating difficulties, while deepening the crisis through anti-reunification actions and war maneuvers against the north but all the people will make a more dynamic advance for independent and peaceful reunification, the declaration noted.
					
					 It pointed out that the organization would take the lead in the mass practical actions to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and, for the present, reject the anachronistic forces for confrontation with the north in this year's "presidential" election and open a new phase of independent and peaceful reunification.
					
					 It underlined the need to bring the reunification movement closer to the reality and expand and intensify it on a more popular basis.
					
					 It expressed the will to take the road of reunification to the end in one mind for national reconciliation, cooperation and co-prosperity.

articles.title: DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries between September 7 and 15 on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 They included a friendship meeting, photo exhibition and film show held by the Sunbula International Friendship Club in Libya, film shows by the Myanmar Medical Research Institute and a company of the Czech Republic and a photo exhibition by the National Library of South Africa.
					
					 On display in their venues were photos showing the feats President Kim Il Sung performed by founding the DPRK and leader Kim Jong Il by developing it and other photos on the revolutionary activities of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were photos on the advantages of Korean-style socialism.
					
					  The participants of films shows watched Korean documentaries including "Pyongyang Today" and "Arms of Korea".

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked by Foreign Media
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of various countries dedicated special write-ups to the 64th birthday of the DPRK.
					 The Democratic Congolese paper L'Avenir on September 10 introduced in detail the feats President Kim Il Sung performed by founding the DPRK. The paper carried a photo of the dear respected Kim Jong Un making a speech at the military parade in celebration of the centenary of birth of the President.
					
					 The paper also conveyed the news that the Korean people who held Kim Il Sung in high esteem as eternal President of the DPRK marked September 9 with splendor.
					
					 The Russian paper Khabarovski Ekspres on Sept. 12 dedicated its two whole pages to a special write-up interwoven with photos of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The paper said under the title of "Hot wind of Kim Jong Un":
					
					The speech made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the military parade in celebration of the centenary of birth of the President evoked great response in the international community.
					
					 Media of various countries observed that the speech has profound meaning.
					
					World media said his speech serves as a political programme of the DPRK and declaration heralding a gigantic start, adding a rosy future is in store for the DPRK under the young leader.
					
					 The Malaysian paper Utusan Malaysia on Sept. 11 carried an article introducing "Arirang", the extravaganza now going on in the DPRK.
					
					 The Rostov-Na-Donu Anti-Bourgeois Front of Russia on Sept. 11 posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "Socialism with Songun, independent power" illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Jong Suk Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Jong Suk Praised Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) --World public circles are praising anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk as woman commander of Korea, great woman revolutionary and world-famous heroine. 
					 The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in an article posted on the internet website said that Kim Jong Suk was a prominent revolutionary and great patriot who dedicated herself to the country and its people and posterity. 
					
					 Kim Jong Suk Library in Peru in its bulletin said that recorded in the history of anti-Japanese war are the exploits Kim Jong Suk performed by devotedly protecting President Kim Il Sung politically and ideologically. 
					
					 The chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union said Kim Jong Suk waged an uncompromising struggle to uphold the idea and line of the President and protected his safety as a shield in hard-fought battles. 
					
					 The Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association said Kim Jong Suk brought up her son Kim Jong Il in a simple log cabin in the Paektusan Secret Camp where gunfire was heard during the great anti-Japanese war and led him to successfully carry forward the cause of President Kim Il Sung with arms. 
					
					 The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea in its bulletin said that after the liberation of Korea Kim Jong Suk made a great contribution to developing the Korean People's Revolutionary Army into the regular Korean People's Army and consolidating the military foundation for building a new country. 
					
					 The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy in its bulletin said that the life of Kim Jong Suk was the life of love for future. 
					
					 The Russian newspaper Nahodkinski Rabochi said a lot of Korean women grew to be excellent revolutionaries under the care of Kim Jong Suk who earned fame as an anti-Japanese war hero and woman commander of Mt. Paektu by participating in the great anti-Japanese war led by President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea in an article posted on its Internet website said that the noble exploits of Kim Jong Suk would always shine with the victoriously advance of socialist Korea.

articles.title: US Tests Nuclear Weapons
articles.content:
US Tests Nuclear Weapons
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is persistently conducting the test of nuclear weapons to reinforce nuclear forces.
					 Kyodo News disclosed on Sept. 19 that the U.S. conducted its fifth test using plutonium to examine the capacity of nukes from April to June this year.
					
					 It was reported that used in the recent test conducted at a research center in New Mexico was a "Z machine" which emits strong X-rays without using a nuclear test place or causing any explosion.

articles.title: Putin Urges Russia to Increase Defense Capability
articles.content:
Putin Urges Russia to Increase Defense Capability
 Moscow, September 21 (KCNA) -- Russian President Vladimir Putin recently urged Russia to increase its defense capability amid the "growing use of force in the international affairs." He said this before the soldiers who performed meritorious deeds in the Kavkaz-2012 strategic drills.
					 Putin expressed the stand of his government to steadily step up the work for equipping Russia's armed forces with modern and technological military hardware.
					
					 Saying that the military service is always being regarded as honorable one, he called for loving the country and undergoing the military service well just like those who devotedly defended their country during the fiercest period.

articles.title: China Succeeds in Launching Two Navigation Satellites
articles.content:
China Succeeds in Launching Two Navigation Satellites
 Beijing, September 21 (KCNA) -- China on Wednesday succeeded in placing the fourteenth and fifteenth Beidou navigation satellites into the expected orbit.
					 The satellites were carried by a Long March-3A rocket at the Xichang Satellite Launch Center.

articles.title: China's Xi Calls "Purchase" of Diaoyu Islands "Farce," Urges Japan to Stop
articles.content:
China's Xi Calls "Purchase" of Diaoyu Islands "Farce," Urges Japan to Stop
 Beijing, September 21 (KCNA) -- Chinese Vice President Xi Jinping on Wednesday said in a meeting with U.S. Defense Secretary Leon Panetta that Japan's "purchase" of Diaoyu Islands was a farce and urged Japan to stop any behavior that infringes upon China's sovereignty.
					 Xi recalled the "September 18 Incident," which directly preceded Japan's invasion of northeast China in 1931, saying Japanese militarism affected not only the Chinese, but also the United States and Asia-Pacific countries.
					
					Rather than reflect on the trauma Japan brought to neighboring countries and some Asia-Pacific countries, Japanese political forces have continued to make mistakes by staging the farce of "purchasing" Diaoyu Islands, Xi said.
					
					 He said Japan's "purchase" openly questions the legal effects of the Cairo Declaration and the Potsdam Proclamation and has intensified the neighbors' territorial disputes.
					
					Xi said the international community will never tolerate Japan's attempt to deny the outcomes of the World Anti-Fascist War.
					
					"Japan should rein in its behavior and stop any words and acts that undermine China's sovereignty and territorial integrity," Xi noted.
					
					 Xi also called on the United States to act in the larger interest of regional peace and stability, mind its words and actions, not to get involved in issues regarding the sovereignty of Diaoyu Islands and refrain from doing anything that might escalate tensions and complicate the situation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige institutos de Verduras y de Plantas Decorativas
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige institutos de Verduras y de Plantas Decorativas
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno el Instituto de Ciencia de Verduras de Pyongyang y el Instituto de Plantas Decorativas de Pyongyang, cuyas capacidades fueron ampliadas.
					Ante todo, el Mariscal realizo la visita de orientacion al Instituto de Ciencias de Verduras de Pyongyang.
					
					Se mostro muy satisfecho de que en pleno acato a las tareas dadas por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il durante su visita realizada en marzo del ano pasado, el instituto haya ampliado la capacidad del invernadero y aumentado vertiginosamente la produccion.
					
					Al ver que en la sala de suministracion de solucion nutritiva y la de control computerizado se cultivan las verduras por la inyeccion automatica de distintas soluciones nutritivas, el Mariscal quedo complacido de que se haya preparado la firme garantia para aumentar la produccion de verduras mediante el sistema de produccion segun la tecnologia de punta.
					
					En la sala de biotecnologia volvio a mostrar gran satisfaccion diciendo que le gusta mucho todo lo cientifizado. 
					
					En las parcelas de investigacion y experimentacion escucho con satisfaccion el parte de que aqui se cultivan mas de 50 variedades de verduras incluso mas de 20 especies de tomate enviadas por si mismo.
					
					Durante su visita realizada en marzo del ano pasado el Dirigente dio las instrucciones de hacer el cultivo experimental de berenjena redonda, el rabano Phyonggang, etc., recordo y enseno que el Dirigente fue un erudito de verduras.
					
					Subrayo la necesidad de cultivar y producir mucho buenas variedades sabrosas, nutritivas y convenientes a las condiciones climaticas de nuestro pais y suministrarlas suficientemente a los habitantes. 
					
					Para reducir el costo y asegurar el rendimiento real en la gestion del invernadero es preciso utilizar la energia geotermica, la solar y la eolica para la calefaccion, enseno.
					
					El Instituto de Ciencias de Verduras de Pyongyang es tan magnifico como un mar de invernaderos, dijo y agrego que deben construir tales invernaderos en todas las provincias. 
					
					Manifesto la esperanza de que los cientificos y empleados del Instituto alcanzaran en el futuro grandes exitos en la investigacion y produccion de verduras y tomo una foto con ellos. 
					
					Luego, el Mariscal estuvo de visita en el Instituto de Plantas Decorativas de Pyongyang.
					
					Escuchando las explicaciones ante el plano, hizo conocimiento de la investigacion y la produccion. 
					
					Se mostro satisfecho de que la capacidad de produccion de plantas decorativas se haya aumentado mas de 20 veces en comparacion con el tiempo anterior en suministrar muchas flores a las florerias. 
					
					Escucho con satisfaccion el parte de que despues de la visita de orientacion del Dirigente cultivaron nuevamente mas de 20 variedades y las registraron  como variedades estatales. 
					
					Al ver cymbidium que se cultiva en el invernadero, el Mariscal dijo que deben cultivar mucho las flores como cymbidium que mantiene largamente sus flores.
					
					En la sala de elaboracion de los articulos hechos con flores, evaluo que el Instituto de Plantas Decorativas haya hecho bien los articulos de flor consultando los datos enviados por si mismo y agrego que en adelante las florerias tambien podrian hacer los cestos y ramos de flores y otros articulos florales. 
					
					Puesto que se ha fijado el Dia de la Madre, las madres y esposas estaran alegres si reciben las flores ese dia, dijo. 
					
					Deben importar las semillas de flores de fama mundial y aclimatarlas de acuerdo con las condiciones de nuestro pais, indico.
					
					La rama de investigacion de flores debe aceptar las experiencias avanzadas de otros paises, apunto y agrego la necesidad de cientifizar e industrializar el florecimiento. 
					
					El Mariscal se fotografio junto a los cientificos y empleados del Instituto.
					
					Y dio su agradecimiento a los profesores, empleados y estudiantes de la Universidad          Kim Il Sung, constructores militares, cientificos y empleados quienes con el alma patriotica hicieron ingentes esfuerzos por construir los dos institutos.
					
					El Mariscal fue acompanado por Jang Song Thaek, Kim Ki Nam, Ri Jae Il, Ri Ryong Ha, Pak Thae Song, Kim Pyong Ho y Pak Chun Hong.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente chileno
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente chileno
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 15 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Chile, Sebastian Pinera Echenique en ocasion del 202o aniversario de la independencia de este pais.
					  El remitente desea al destinatario mayores exitos en su trabajo para el desarrollo del pais y la justicia social y al amistoso pueblo chileno el bienestar y la prosperidad.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a su homologo nicaraguense
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a su homologo nicaraguense
Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 21 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Nicaragua, Daniel Ortega Saavedra, con motivo del 191o aniversario de la independencia de este pais.
					  El remitente expresa la confianza de que se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.
					
					  Desea al destinatario mayores exitos en su preciosa labor para el desarrollo sostenido de la economia y el bienestar del pueblo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente guatemalteco
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente guatemalteco
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 21 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Guatemala, Otto Perez Molina, en ocasion del 191o aniversario de la independencia de este pais.
					  El remitente expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se ampliaran y se desarrollaran conforme a los intereses comunes de los pueblos de los dos paises.

articles.title: Informacion de comandancia del frente sudoeste del EPC
articles.content:
Informacion de comandancia del frente sudoeste del EPC
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La comandancia del Frente Sudoeste del Ejercito Popular de Corea hizo publica el dia 22 la siguiente informacion:
					En estos dias, al entrar en la estacion de coger los cangrejos azules se tornan mas serios los actos de violacion de los titeres surcoreanos en las aguas jurisdiccionales del Mar Oeste de Corea.
					
					Se profundiza cada dia mas el centro de creciente violacion de aguas jurisdiccionales de los buques de las fuerzas navales del ejercito titere.
					
					Se perpetran diariamente en 5 islas del Mar Oeste y sus contornos los provocativos tiros de fusiles y canones apuntando a la RPDC.
					
					Durante el dia 21, muchas lanchas rapidas de las fuerzas navales del ejercito titere infiltraron profundamente varias veces en las aguas jurisdiccionales de la parte Norte de la linea de demarcacion del mar al sudoeste de la isla Yonphyong y armaron el tumulto de tirar los fusiles y canones.
					
					Lo mas grave es que los titeres dispararon sin piedad armas de fuego diciendo que las contrapartes son barcos civiles con fines pacificos.
					
					Esta locura es la aventurera provocacion militar que pueden escenificar solo los belicistas de la capa militar titere del Sur de Corea que imitan la costumbre malsana de su amo norteamericano.
					
					El problema reside en que tales provocaciones militares se perpetran so pretexto de desordenado trabajo de pesca de los barcos pesqueros de otros paises.
					
					Los titeres inventan la falsedad e insistencia forzada como si los barcos pesqueros de la RPDC hubieran pasado la ilegal "linea de limite al Norte" que no ha reconocido nunca.
					
					La realidad muestra vil conducta de los titeres surcoreanos sabiendas a que son los barcos de otro pais hablando tanto de que estos son de la RPDC por miedo de aquella nacion.  
					
					Tambien, muestra fehacientemente cuan cobarde es la capa militar que produce tal escandalo, temida por la reaccion del EPC, tras disparar los fusiles y canones en las aguas jurisdiccionales de la RPDC y cuan miserables las conductas de los titeres que se aferran a mantener a toda costa la bandidesca "linea de limite al Norte".
					
					La banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak y los belicistas de la capa militar surcoreana deben actuar con prudencia dandose clara cuenta de su situacion miserable.
					
					La Comandancia del Frente Suroeste del EPC ya esta dispuesta a cumplir la orden de operacion dada por la Comandancia Suprema de convertir el Mar Oeste de Corea en la trampa de eliminar a los enemigos si estos se muevan ni un poco y la operacion del frente suroeste, en la gran guerra por la reunificacion de la patria.
					
					Nos queda solo la accion de ataque fuerte de las unidades de nuestro frente que no sabe limite.

articles.title: CNCDP denuncia campana anti-RPDC de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
CNCDP denuncia campana anti-RPDC de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite Nacional Coreano por la Defensa de la Paz (CNCDP) hizo publica este sabado la siguiente declaracion:
					En el marco del entrenamiento de "Iniciativa de Seguridad contra la Proliferacion" (PSI en ingles), la banda titere del Sur de Corea planea desarrollar los dias 26 y 27 que vienen en el mar frente a Pusan un entrenamiento de interrupcion naval para registrar y perseguir a los barcos sospechosos de cargo de armas de exterminio masivo movilizando muchos efectivos junto con Estados Unidos, Japon, Australia, etc.
					
					La "PSI", inventada en 2003 por la administracion norteamericana de Bush para bloquear y oprimir a los paises independientes y antiyanquis incluyendo a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, contraviene completamente a la ley internacional y es un producto de la bandidesca maniobra agresiva que viola seriamente el Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea, razon por la cual fue objeto de fuertes censuras internas y externas desde el principio.
					
					Fabricando tal "iniciativa", EE.UU. hablo abiertamente de que la "iniciativa" sirve de "otra flecha de entre las que se dirigen contra el Norte de Corea", lo cual demuestra fehacientemente el caracter provocativo y agresivo del presente simulacro.
					
					Por eso, tambien el anterior "poder" surcoreano sintio escrupulos para tomar parte en el entrenamiento.
					
					Sin embargo, la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak, enloquecida al servilismo proyanqui y confrontacion fratricida, aprobo la participacion total en "PSI" tan pronto como tomara el poder y participo activamente en el simulacro diciendo que "sin el Norte (de Corea), la PSI es innecesaria".
					
					Por lo tanto, tal intento pone al desnudo la voluntad de agredir a la RPDC y agrava aun mas el peligro de guerra
					
					El Comite Nacional Coreano por la Defensa de la Paz califica tal maniobra criminal de EE.UU. y la horda de traidores de Lee de una provocacion militar intolerable e imprudente alboroto de guerra para violar seriamente la soberania y la dignidad de la RPDC y desatar, cueste lo que cueste, la guerra de agresion al Norte, y lo condena rotundamente en nombre de todos los coreanos.
					
					En la actualidad, diversos estratos del Sur de Corea se oponen resueltamente al presente simulacro que agrava la agudizada tension militar de la Peninsula Coreana y destruye la paz de la region del Noreste Asiatico y tambien los paises vecinos expresan la seria preocupacion por el respecto.
					
					Ya hemos declarado claramente que tomara como la declaracion de guerra contra la RPDC la participacion de la banda del traidor Lee en el entrenamiento "PSI".
					
					El ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC nunca estaran con los brazos cruzados ante las freneticas maquinaciones de guerra de la banda titere.
					
					Haciendo frente al imprudente proceder de los belicistas yanquis y surcoreanos, todos los uniformados y civiles coreanos, que esperan la orden de ataque final en las trincheras ya ocupadas, exterminaran, como han declarado ya, a todas las hordas de los agresores mediante los fuegos de represalia justa y despiadada si se lanza una sola bala contra la RPDC.
					
					La banda del traidor Lee debe actuar con prudencia dandose clara cuenta del vehemente rencor del ejercito y pueblo coreanos y su impetu de exterminar a los enemigos.
					
					Diversos estratos del Sur de Corea y los pueblos del mundo amantes de la paz deberan rechazar rotundamente el citado entrenamiento que agrava mas la tension militar en la Peninsula Coreana y la region del Noreste Asiatico y acarrea el peligro de guerra nuclear.
